Players:

Rob13 TheReverend Bacde, Macho Cop, survived.
Shisou Thor665*, Vanilla Townie, survived.

Dead:
YOLO kashoodles*, Mafia Goon, was lynched day 1.
Ms Marangal, Vanilla Townie, was lynched day 2.
Dannflor Nachomamma8*, Town Doctor, was killed night 2.
Messiah* Human Destroyer*, Vanilla Townie, was lynched day 3.
Drummer*, Vanilla Townie, was killed night 3.
The Central Scrutinizer*, Mafia Goon, was lynched day 4.

Game State:
GAME OVER

*prod

Sample VT Role PM:
Mod wrote:Hello [player], welcome to Mafibleh! You are a Vanilla Townie. You have no special powers or abilities. You are Town-aligned and win when all living players are Town. Game thread is [here]. Please cofirm your role via PM.

Rules
(Slightly modified from Amrun's, who referenced Equinox, ReaperCharlie, LlamaFluff, Vi, and dramonic)

General

1. Be familiar with the sitewide rules and guidelines.
2. Personal attacks will not be tolerated. Use of homophobic, racist, sexist, or any other derogatory slurs falls under this rule. Keep it civil.
3. Play to your win condition.
4. Unless otherwise specified in your role PM or by me, you may not communicate outside of this thread while the game is running.
5. Do not quote or post any screen captures of any private communication to which you have access. This includes game-related PMs, QuickTopics, and instant messaging logs. Paraphrasing is okay.
6. If it is not visible to the naked eye, do not post it. This includes, but is not limited to: invisible text, tiny text, encrypted text, and text hidden within tags. Clickable spoiler text, however, is allowed, as long as it is used within reason.
7. If you have the ability to edit your posts, don't use it in my game.
8. Blue is reserved for the moderator. All other formatting is fair game with the provision that you do not impersonate me or post in hidden text, as covered in another rule.

Activity

1. Prods will be issued to players if they have not posted within a 72-hour period. Players who have been prodded have 36 hours to respond in the game thread before a replacement is sought.
2. Players who have been prodded 3 times are subject to replacement without further notice. After three prods, replacements will happen upon my discretion. You will also be replaced if you require two prods in one Day. Prod timers re-set with each new game Day.
3. Posting content is an absolute must. If a player posts nothing but prod dodges for an entire game Day, he or she will be subject to replacement upon my discretion.
4. If you anticipate being away for at least 48 hours, please PM me AND post a V/LA notice in the thread with the expected date of your return.

Pre-Game

1. During Pre-Game you will receive your role PM. Confirm by posting in the thread.
2. Confirmed players will be bolded on the player list. When 7/9 players have confirmed, Day 1 will begin.
3. All QTs are open during pre-game.

Day

1. Days will have a deadline of 21 real-time days for Day 1, and 14 real days for all others. Deadline extensions will be granted only in extreme circumstances.
2. Players may vote to No Lynch; a no lynch will occur if 50% of players vote for no lynch or if no majority is achieved by deadline.
3. Lynch is achieved by simple majority.
4. Once majority is reached, no further votes or unvotes will count.
5. Votes should be on a separate line and flushed left, and MUST be bolded (e.g., Vote: Amrun). The same applies to vote revocations (e.g., Unvote). Unvotes are preferred but not necessary when switching votes (e.g., Unvote, Vote: Amrun). Use of the vote tags (e.g., VOTE: Amrun) is optional. Abbreviations are okay as long as it's clear for whom the vote is made.
6. Let me repeat. All votes/unvotes MUST be flushed left and bolded or use the appropriate tag.
7. All players, including the lynched player, are allowed to discuss in twilight phase until I post the death scene.
8. Dead players may make one "Bah!" post that contains no game-related content, but it must also contain a picture of a tigershark and/or the word FAILHULK

Night

1. Nights will last at least 48 hours and no more than 72 hours.
2. Players who have a night action to submit must send it in before the announced deadline. I accept provisional actions up until the announced deadline, at which time I will use the last action submitted.

Moderator Actions

1. Flavor is for entertainment purposes only and has no significance in the game.
2. If there is an error in the vote count or something similar, bold your concern in the thread. Please PM me for all other issues.
3. Violations of these rules will result in consequences. Pretending to violate these rules will also result in consequences. What those consequences are depend on the severity of the action and on the game state.
4. Any situation not covered above will be handled on a case-by-case basis.
5. I reserve the right to add, modify, or remove rules as necessary. I will notify you of all changes in the thread.

Please PM me if you need clarification on anything in the rules.

Hey guys, sorry for the delay. I've been pretty sick lately and won't be starting this until I'm healthy. I'm feeling a bit better today so here's to hoping that with a good night's sleep, this is opened tomorrow!

Role PMs have been sent. I'll open the thread once I have 7/9 confirmations.

Current confirmations: 7/9.
7/9 received.  Game on.

I'm basing this speculation on absolutely nothing but my own intuition, which is based on the games I used to play on this site years ago, but here's my line of reasoning:

1. Non-vanilla roles are more scarce than vanilla roles.
2. People like to be non-vanilla roles.
3. Because of 1 and 2, people tend to value non-vanilla roles more highly than vanilla roles.
4. 3 is even more so in the case of scum roles because scum is the other "team" in the game, and you only get to play the other team every once in a while.
5. In a mass replacement scenario, people are more likely to hold onto roles they value more highly.
6. Therefore, in a mass replacement scenario, town roles are more likely to replace out than scum roles.

Feel free to quibble with me on this, but I feel like my logic is at least not nonsense, and so I will vote accordingly. 2/5 chance of hitting scum is better than 2/9.

This doesn't invalidate your vote for me in any way. If you agree with my speculation, then lynching me is a positive information play, and you should do it -- so long as you honestly think that none of Jun, MM, YOLO, or Drummer are more likely scum than I am. Jun - my gut read was initially very strong town. Her reaction under pressure did not look like something a scum would do. She then softy repudiates her argument and declares herself "uneasy" with the Jun wagon as attention shifts to me. She honestly looks to me like scum who's just content to sit back and let the town eat itself alive with a minimal amount of prodding here and there. If I wind up today's lynch, I implore you to take a serious look at lynching her on day three once you lynch YOLO.

YOLO - is literally voting for me because my read didn't agree at all with the popular opinion at the time (Jun wagon). What kind of reason is that? Not a reason at all. I can understand thinking a person who doesn't see things the way you do is scummy -- I do it. But I can't understand voting for someone simply because they differ from the groupthink. From my perspective, it seems to me like he thinks this argument will make it easier for him to pull people off of Jun's wagon onto mine. Scummy.

Drummer - is the only one of the other four original cast members I would say has done actual scumhunting this game. He states an actual reason for suspecting me, unlike YOLO.
